label: negative
text_a: I was at the laundromat last Sunday. There was a cute girl doing her laundry there too. I went up and started making small talk. She smiled but didn't seem interested.
text_b: I bought her a dress that afternoon.

label: negative
text_a: Zeke was throwing a Halloween party. All his friends were dressing up. Zeke thought about being a vampire or a wizard. Then he decided on a scarier costume.
text_b: Zeke would dress up as a pumpkin.

label: positive
text_a: The school bell rang when the clock struck 2. Gina was never more happy for a day to end. She grabbed her things and waited at the door for Tami. But Tami was leaving with Rita and Mary.
text_b: Gina felt lonely when she went home.

label: positive
text_a: I went to babysit my 5-year-old nephew in San Francisco. My sister encouraged me to bike her kid to school. I was afraid to bike across the city with my nephew in tow. Instead, we biked through Golden Gate Park to the beach and the zoo.
text_b: We had a great time!

label: negative
text_a: Timmy was caught with unpaid parking tickets. He didn't have enough money to pay for them. Instead he had to be arrested and jailed for two days. He lost his jobs for missing work.
text_b: Timmy was promoted for working so much all the time.

label: positive
text_a: Gina didn't want to sit at her desk near her old friends. She could feel the tension between them. She decided to ask to go to the library. Her teacher agreed to allow her to go for an hour.
text_b: Gina felt more calm once she arrived in the library.

label: negative
text_a: Jill had problems breathing one day. She went to the doctor and she discovered she had anxiety. She began to practice meditation. Her anxiety is now under control.
text_b: Jill stopped meditating.

label: negative
text_a: Fred was a new student in class. He was really awkward and he had a hard time. Nobody seemed to want to be friends with him. Later at lunch someone ate with him.
text_b: Fred was popular.

label: positive
text_a: Today was Iris's fifth birthday! Her mom had planned her a surprise party. All of her friends were there. She opened presents and had cake.
text_b: Iris had a lot of fun at her party.

label: negative
text_a: Laura woke up early to make it to her class on time. She made herself breakfast before she left for school. After breakfast, Laura left her house and got on the bus. When she got to school, she saw a sign that said class cancelled!
text_b: Laura had a good day in class that day.

label: positive
text_a: Renee was inspired by the music of Eddie Van Halen. She decided to learn to play guitar. She bought an electric guitar and an amp. She hated pressing the strings with her fingers.
text_b: Renee decided she would have to get used to it.

label: negative
text_a: Jake went on a ski trip in the mountains with his friends. Jake wasn't very good at skiing but went anyways. One day, they were all going down a challenging slope. The other boys were fine but Jake fell and broke his leg!
text_b: Jake tried skiing again the following day.

label: negative
text_a: One man bet another that he could outstare a duck. A duck was found and stared at. Although the duck was unaware of what was happening, it did not blink. It did, however, wet its eyes with its nictitating membrane.
text_b: The man wanted to lose his bet.

label: negative
text_a: Bobby was a star football player at his school. He would always get recognition for his talent. One day he was in a very important game. His arm was hurt in the process.
text_b: Bobby passed the football for hours after the game.

label: positive
text_a: James has just started working at a company with a ping pong table. He has always wanted to play ping pong with a coworker. One day after work, his friend challenges him to a game. James plays very well, but eventually loses the game.
text_b: So, James bought a ping pong table to practice at home.

label: positive
text_a: One weekend we wanted to see a movie with the kids. There were two movies they wanted to see. So we decided to divide and conquer. Two kids and myself went to one and my husband and our son another.
text_b: Both groups had a great time seeing the movies they wanted.

label: negative
text_a: Gordon bought his son a remote control car for Christmas. But he realized that it needed AA batteries. Gordon could not find any. So the next day, he went to the toy store where he bought the car.
text_b: He bought another remote control car for himself.

label: positive
text_a: Julie loved to read anything she could get her hands on. Most of her time was spent in the library. Her favorite library was staffed by Miss Watson. Miss Watson saw Julie's love of books and offered her a job.
text_b: Julie happily accepted!

label: positive
text_a: I went to las vegas. I learned that i really like the slot machines. I spent a lot of time on them. i spent a lot of money.
text_b: I was upset when I lost all my money.

label: negative
text_a: Margie had a Christmas cactus. It never bloomed. She gave the plant to Desi. Desi took good care of the plant.
text_b: The goldfish were very happy and healthy.

label: negative
text_a: I woke up hungry. I poured a bowl of cereal but found I did not have any milk. After contemplating using water I decided to go to the store. I walked to the corner and got a half gallon of 2%.
text_b: I came home and ate pizza.

label: negative
text_a: Jennifer was hungry on a rainy day. She looked through her house, but didn't have much. Suddenly, she noticed a can on her shelf. She looked at it and it was chicken noodle soup.
text_b: Jennifer couldn't find food so she went hungry.

label: negative
text_a: My class went to the Everglades for our field trip. We did some sightseeing in several of the forests. We also got the opportunity to travel in water. The bus ride home was long and boring.
text_b: I was invigorated when I got home.

label: positive
text_a: Gina and her friend Lisa were listening to music in the garage. Gina hoped her other friends would come over and join them. She called them, but no one answered. The girls decided to dance to cure their boredom.
text_b: They all had a good time anyway.

label: negative
text_a: I was riding my bike to work one summer morning. I was a little late, so I was in a hurry. I was biking a little recklessly. To my dismay, my reckless biking caused me to get in an accident.
text_b: I knew then that I wanted to become a professional cyclist.

label: negative
text_a: Martha was a terrible cook and her boyfriend knew it. He introduced her to cooking shows and watched them with her. She would practice things she learned on the shows. As the days went by her cooking began to slowly get better.
text_b: Martha became an expert seamstress after a while.

label: positive
text_a: Maxine usually hates to shave her legs. She doesn't like the feeling of using a razor. One night Maxine has a big date and decides to wear a dress. She shaves her legs for the occasion.
text_b: Maxine gets laser removal next time.

label: negative
text_a: The girls went to a bar. They opened a tab. They had a few drinks. They finally decided to close their tab.
text_b: They got into the plane.

label: positive
text_a: Larry regretted that he hadn't seen his aunt in months. He decided to take the long trip to Idaho to see her. Larry packed his bags and drove to Idaho. His Aunt was very happy to see him.
text_b: Larry started making regular trips to see his Aunt.

label: positive
text_a: Mario got up out of bed. Today was his wedding day and he already felt the butterflies. He shaved and showered happily. He got dressed and went to the church.
text_b: It was the best day of his life.

label: positive
text_a: All Kevin wanted in life was to buy his fiance a house. He became near obsessed, saving every penny. He worked multiple jobs and lived as a miser. After a year, Kevin had enough money for a down payment.
text_b: Kevin bought a house.

label: positive
text_a: Barry had only one thousand dollars left in his bank account. He needed to find a job. He searched for 3 months. Eventually, his money ran out.
text_b: He had to go to a homeless shelter.

label: negative
text_a: Fred is brand new to exercising and just joined a gym. He was amazing at how expensive a personal trainer was. He wanted to get into shape but couldn't afford the rates. He found personal trainer routines online for free.
text_b: He never worked out again.

label: negative
text_a: Linda went to buy some frozen yogurt. She saw some white yogurt and assumed it was vanilla. She loved vanilla, so that was what she got. She tasted it and it was horrible.
text_b: Linda was very pleased.

label: positive
text_a: Levi was very excited about making candles with his mom. He had went to the store with her and helped her pick out scents. Today was the day to make the candles. Levi helped poor the wax into the molds.
text_b: They burned their candles that evening.

label: negative
text_a: Kelsi always wanted a new pool. She begged her parents for Years to get one. Finally they caved in and allowed her to have one. Kelsi was elated and could not believe it.
text_b: Kelsi had no interest in the pool her parents bought.

label: negative
text_a: Janice usually wears jeans to work every day. However, now she has been promoted to manager. She decides she needs to dress a little more formally. Janice buys a few pairs of khakis for work.
text_b: She wore a ripped shirt the next day.

label: positive
text_a: Sara was a dancer. She was practicing for her recital. As she went to go on pointe, she heard a loud pop. Sarah broke her big toe.
text_b: Sara cried out in pain.

label: positive
text_a: Gertrude was notoriously clumsy and awkward. Her friends thought that participating in a sport may help her. She decided to try out for the soccer team at school. She ran out on the field and unexpectedly tripped over the ball.
text_b: Naturally, she was not accepted to the soccer team.

label: negative
text_a: One day Adam bought two BB guns. He gave one to his son, Christian. Christian wanted to play with the guns in the house. Christian shot the gun and broke the screen on the television.
text_b: Adam was very proud of Christian.

label: positive
text_a: When I was younger, I went to summer camp. We had a lot of fun playing games with the counselors. My favorite thing to do was play cards. The camp counselors knew so many different card games.
text_b: My favorite card game was poker.

label: positive
text_a: A young boy wanted to pitch for his baseball team. He practiced a lot with his brothers. At practice his coach let him try out as pitcher. The boy did not do well.
text_b: The young boy went home disappointed.

label: positive
text_a: Gary wanted to get Lisa's attention. One day he decides to write Lisa a Poem. The next day at school, Gary sees Lisa in the hallway. Gary gives Lisa a really big smile and hands her the poem.
text_b: Lisa confesses she also has a crush on Gary.

label: positive
text_a: Gina's dad pulled into the 24 hour Walgreen's parking lot. It was nearly 4 AM but everyone went inside. They needed toothbrushes before they went to grandma's house. It was Gina's job to pack them before they left.
text_b: Gina felt guilty about forgetting everyone's toothbrushes.

label: positive
text_a: Neil had enjoyed Chinese food in Hunan. But he was told the spicier food was in Szechuan province. Intrigued, he took a train there. Then he ordered a plate of rice and noodles.
text_b: He felt like his mouth was on fire.

label: negative
text_a: Kim had eaten deer meat without knowing what type of meat it was. She found the thought disgusting. She ran to the bathroom as she gagged. By the time she reached the bathroom the gagging had subsided.
text_b: She went back and had another large serving of deer meat.

label: positive
text_a: Bob loved to watch movies. He was looking forward to a three day weekend coming up. He made a list of his favorite movies and invited some friends over. He spent the weekend with his friends watching all his favorite movies
text_b: Bob had a great time.

label: negative
text_a: Lauren has always wanted to wear skinny jeans to parties. However, she needs to lose weight so the skinny jeans will look good. Lauren begins a challenging exercise regimen. Finally she has lost enough weight to wear skinny jeans.
text_b: She was jealous.

label: negative
text_a: Mike was tired of work and needed a vacation. Unfortunately, Mike had no idea where he should go. He then decided to spin a globe and go where his finger landed. Mike's finger landed on Hawaii.
text_b: Mike went to France.

label: negative
text_a: Kelly went down to the ocean to relax. She immediately went and put her feet in. As she put her feet in however, the wave captured her. Her clothes got soaked.
text_b: Kelly was very happy to have soaking wet clothes.

label: positive
text_a: My children and I visited the local animal shelter. We looked at puppies and kittens in their cages. My daughters picked out a friendly puppy. They played with her and rubbed her belly.
text_b: I adopted the puppy for my daughter.

label: positive
text_a: Nya wanted to see the parade downtown. She caught three buses. Then she took the subway. She made it downtown just in time.
text_b: Nya was excited to be able to watch the parade.

label: positive
text_a: Jill was surprised when a handsome boy asked her to the college dance. As her roommates got ready, Jill fussed about her hair. Jill's roommates said they could help. Jill finished dressing into her toga-like white gown.
text_b: Her date arrived and complimented her appearance.

label: negative
text_a: Henry ran across a baked goods sales. The young lady gave him a small muffin. He took a bite out of it. However, a worm came out of the hole.
text_b: Henry continued to enjoy the muffin.

label: negative
text_a: Dana's mother came to visit for a week. Dana's husband Glenn thinks her mother is trying to poison him. During breakfast Glenn stomach starts to cramp. Glen becomes outraged.
text_b: However, Glen hugs his mother-in-law.

label: negative
text_a: Jeremiah is looking for a part time job that can help him earn money. A sandwich shop employs him to give out flyers about their sandwiches. Jeremiah loves the job at first, because he likes meeting new people. Eventually he finds it tiresome to be outside so much.
text_b: Jeremiah continues to work outside.

label: positive
text_a: Sean wanted to go out for a picnic. He packed himself a lunch in a basket. Then, he rode his bike off to a field. In the field, he ate his picnic.
text_b: Sean loved the outdoors.

label: negative
text_a: Brandon lives in Clearwater. He enjoys living by the ocean. A pier was built near his house. He decided to get his fishing license.
text_b: Brandon then became a surfer.

label: positive
text_a: Bill's father told him to keep practicing his piano scales. He was an expert pianist, and wanted the same for his son. Bill was too young to understand the value of practice. He bitterly sat at the piano, playing his scales over and over.
text_b: As Bill got older, he realized all of that practice help him.

label: positive
text_a: Tony and Mark were fierce rivals on the basketball court. Everyday after school they would meet at the local blacktop to play. They would always play one on one. They were always so evenly matched.
text_b: The games were very close.

label: negative
text_a: Alex was getting fits of dizziness. He was so nervous that he checked his symptoms online. The online results convinced him that he had a terrible disease. He scheduled an appointment with his doctor in a hurry.
text_b: Alex skipped his doctor's appointment.

label: negative
text_a: I waited in line all day to see a movie I knew I would like. I was so excited to see this movie. When I got into the theater, I was so excited I almost couldn't move. I watched the whole movie.
text_b: I left after the first forty five minutes.

label: negative
text_a: Kristen was tired of her room. She need to move it around for a change. She hadn't moved it in over four Year's. After moving everything she saw a huge stain where her bed covered.
text_b: Melanie decided that the room looked perfect now.

label: positive
text_a: Shay went to the marine park. There she saw a sign advertising dolphin swims. Shay eagerly handed over her $40 and suited up. Then she jumped in the pool to swim with the dolphins.
text_b: Shay had a great time.

label: positive
text_a: Dirk was a fine pianist. He often performed out in public for money. During his last performance, one of the keys broke off his keyboard. He finished the performance as best he could, but the music was poor.
text_b: Dirk was embarrassed.

label: positive
text_a: Brad was sick with a cold! He wanted to go out and play! He was too weak to move. His mother gave him soup and medicine.
text_b: Brad's mother was very caring.

label: positive
text_a: Julie wants to make food for lunch for the upcoming week. She decides to hard boil a dozen eggs. Julie boils water and dumps the eggs in for 8 minutes each. Finally her eggs are boiled perfectly.
text_b: Julie gets busy making lunches using the boiled eggs.

label: positive
text_a: Carl joined the military right after high school. He signed a short contract that put him on the front lines. His best friend was killed in front of him. Happiness became a foreign concept to Carl.
text_b: Carl had to go to therapy for post-traumatic stress disorder.

label: positive
text_a: Everyone in my family got together for Thanksgiving. It was a long journey for many, but they made it. We all sat together and ate dinner. After dinner, we visited and caught up.
text_b: We had a great time.

label: negative
text_a: My laboratory professor was explaining today's lab. He told us not to pour water followed by an acid. While I was looking at my notes, I barely paid attention. When the experiment began, I poured water before an acid in a tube.
text_b: My professor congratulated me.

label: positive
text_a: Jill saw an infomercial for unbreakable glass cups. She was amazed and ordered them. When Jill received the cups, she wanted to test them. She dropped one on her hardwood floor.
text_b: It broke and Jill felt dumb for believing the hype.

label: negative
text_a: Marcy wondered about the kids. She had been in the kitchen and hadn't heard them in awhile. Usually, when the kids were quiet, they were getting into something. Marcy looked in the bedrooms and didn't see them.
text_b: The children were in the kitchen eating lunch.

label: positive
text_a: Tom was tired of everyday life. So, he decided to move off the grid. His first week was ok, but soon he ran out of water. He suffered for two days and still couldn't find any.
text_b: Eventually Tom went back on the grid.

label: positive
text_a: My old neighbor used to take Halloween too far. His costumes were very elaborate. One year, he decided to be Jason and hide under his garage door. He scared everyone, and the whole neighborhood complained.
text_b: The next year he didn't dress up at all.

label: positive
text_a: Jane's mother made a very good apple pie. Jane always wanted the recipe but her mother wouldn't give it to her. One Christmas, she asked her again for the recipe. Jane's mother decided that she would give her the recipe.
text_b: Jane was thankful to have the recipe.

label: positive
text_a: Yesterday Stacey was driving to work. Unfortunately a large SUV slammed into her. Luckily she was alright. However her car was destroyed.
text_b: Stacey told the police what happened.

label: positive
text_a: Ted loves to go to the movies. He sees almost everyone and votes at the Oscars. He has a big party for the Oscars and they all place bets. Ted almost always wins with the movies he chooses.
text_b: Ted continues to watch several movies a week.

label: positive
text_a: On a cool Saturday afternoon Amy was in her backyard alone. She was practicing her volleyball skills when her dad came out. He offered to help her practice. Amy was grateful.
text_b: They practiced together.

label: positive
text_a: Fred decides that he would like to start remembering his daily life. He goes to the local store and buys a diary. From that day forward, Fred records everything he does in his diary. Year's later Fred references the diary to see how he spent his time.
text_b: Fred enjoyed reading stories from his past.

label: positive
text_a: Deb got fired from her job due to cutbacks. She was very upset and went home to sulk. Her husband told her everything would be alright, but Deb wasn't sure. The next day, Deb's husband set her up with a interview at his job.
text_b: She got the job.

label: negative
text_a: My friends wanted to play Dungeons and Dragons last week. We got together with drinks and started to play. Things quickly deteriorated as we kept drinking. Eventually we pretty much stopped playing and just hung out.
text_b: We all decided to go to Vegas.

label: positive
text_a: When Jay found out her older sister was pregnant, she was nervous. While she was happy for her sister, she was scared to be an aunt. Jay knew that there would be a lot of responsibility involved. But then, she finally came home from school and saw her nephew.
text_b: Jay immediately knew her fears were unfounded.

label: negative
text_a: Simon noticed a moving truck in front of the house next door. The family moving in had a teenage daughter and Simon was smitten. He worked up the courage to go over and introduce himself. She was shy but friendly and receptive enough to encourage him.
text_b: He yelled at her and went home.

label: negative
text_a: Haley was a young scientist at a famous laboratory. Every day, she worked hard on her current project. One of her colleagues was secretly stealing her research. Haley discovered this when he published it in a scientific journal.
text_b: Haley felt she had been supported admirably.

label: negative
text_a: Everyone in my family got together for Thanksgiving. It was a long journey for many, but they made it. We all sat together and ate dinner. After dinner, we visited and caught up.
text_b: We all eventually couldn't stop arguing with one another.

label: negative
text_a: Last night was very scary. We had a tornado warning and terrible thunderstorms. Unfortunately my concert for violin was not canceled. I was required to show up but during the performance lights went out.
text_b: Nobody seemed to notice what had happened.

label: negative
text_a: Hannah was an amazing artist. She always had a natural gift. She decided to enter in an art competition. Thankfully she was able to win the top prize.
text_b: Her parents insisted that her grandmother did most of the sewing.

label: positive
text_a: Jennifer was professional copywriter in a large city. She did good work but always received poor remarks on her reviews. Jennifer found out that her boss was trying to sabotage her! She decided to confront her boss about the negative remarks.
text_b: Jennifer stormed into his office and straightened her boss out.

label: negative
text_a: All Kevin wanted in life was to buy his fiance a house. He became near obsessed, saving every penny. He worked multiple jobs and lived as a miser. After a year, Kevin had enough money for a down payment.
text_b: Kevin used the money that he had saved to buy a sports car.

label: positive
text_a: Nila's mom was diagnosed with stage four cancer. Nila knew her mom did not have a long time to live. Nila made sure to provide her mom with a good life until her death. Nila fostered many good memories with her mom and they were happy.
text_b: Nila loved her mom.

label: positive
text_a: Pam's house was where the party was. Everyone bought gifts. Pam bought a cake. Everyone danced and had fun!
text_b: Pam was a good hostess.

label: negative
text_a: The hubby and I decided to have a date night tonight. We haven't had one in almost a year. Mama came over to watch the kids. We went to dinner and a movie.
text_b: We cursed Mama for what she'd done.

label: positive
text_a: Larry was excited to eat steak for dinner. He made a reservation for 7. He eagerly waited all day for the time to arrive. When he got there, the waiter told him they were out of steak.
text_b: He had to have grilled chicken instead.

label: negative
text_a: Tine wanted to make the track team. She hoped she was fast enough. For a month before tryouts, she ran on her own. She rose early every morning to run for miles.
text_b: Tine sat on the couch and ate bonbons instead of trying out.

label: positive
text_a: Rosie's class was having a little party. She decided to make a fruit salad for everyone. She spent lots of money on the fruit and lots of time preparing it. On the day of the party she scooped a huge bowl of the fruit salad up.
text_b: Rosie's class shared the fruit salad.

label: negative
text_a: Rachel was looking at her daily mail. She found a letter written in a foreign language. Rachel showed the letter to her friends. No one could read or understand the letter.
text_b: Rachel didn't want to know what the letter said.

label: negative
text_a: My friend nathan and his family went to the lake one summer. One day Nathan's dad left and didn't leave a lighter for his mom. Well his mom was very upset and made him walk to the store barefoot. Poor Nathan had to walk down a gravel road to bring his mom matches.
text_b: When Nathan returned, he felt very happy for the exercise.

label: positive
text_a: Portia loves walking through the woods nearby her house. However, she notices that her sneakers are becoming muddy and gross. She decides to buy a pair of hiking boots. Portia finds a pair that is comfortable and not too expensive.
text_b: She is happy with her selection.

label: positive
text_a: Kelly worked at Cedar Point for the summer. One day, while she was working, she found $20 on the ground! She ran to the security booth and gave them the $20. After a week, nobody had claimed the money.
text_b: Kelly used the money treat all her friends to ice cream.

label: negative
text_a: Tim was failing math class. He knew if he didn't pass he would have to go to summer school. He studied hard and asked for extra credit. On the last day of school he found out he passed!
text_b: Tim was terribly disappointed.

label: negative
text_a: Clara went home from work one day. Then she realized she had locked herself out! Her keys were left on the kitchen table that morning. She had to call her mom for help.
text_b: Clara liked being outside.

label: negative
text_a: Core broke her parents glass antique vase. She was afraid of being caught. She swept the glass under the rug. Her parents came and took of their shoes.
text_b: They decided to congratulate Core.

label: positive
text_a: Sean was homeless. He begged for money on the streets. For one week, no one gave him money. He was starving.
text_b: Sean decided to go to a shelter.

label: negative
text_a: Trish hated the outdoors. Her friends convinced her to go camping. She wasn't having a good time. They showed her how to fish and showed her the stars.
text_b: The fish had very interesting mating habits.

label: negative
text_a: Jasper has been avoiding getting a real job for months. He has hated all the previous office jobs that he had. One day he sees a job opening at his local butcher. He applies successfully for the job at the butcher.
text_b: Jasper quits his job the next day.

label: positive
text_a: May was a shelter cat the pet store took in for adoption day. Cathy and her family visited the pet store on adoption day. Cathy fell in love with May as soon as she saw her. After applying to adopt May and being approved, Cathy adopted May.
text_b: May and Cathy got along greatly.

label: negative
text_a: My chest hair was getting out of control. I decided I needed to take some trimmers to it. I stepped into the shower and started to shave it off. The hair started to plug the drain because there was so much.
text_b: I decided to glue the hair back on.

label: positive
text_a: Maggie and her parents were moving to a new town. Maggie was nervous because she didn't know anyone. As soon as she moved in, she went around introducing herself. She ended up making some friends.
text_b: Maggie liked the new town.

label: positive
text_a: Ariel is our 5 month old baby. She had woke up the other morning extremely fussy. We couldn't figure out what was wrong at first. We then seen a fresh tooth popping through her gum line.
text_b: We had a week of hell as her tooth came in.

label: positive
text_a: Dan was walking home from school and saw the window display. There was a train set in the window of the store. Dan wished so badly that he could own this train set. When Dan got home his mother told him she had a surprise.
text_b: She gave Dan the train.

label: negative
text_a: John and Billy became very skilled at beer pong. They entered a contest in college. They won the contest and advanced to the next level. The next level sent them to Vegas.
text_b: John and Billy were disappointed.

label: negative
text_a: Today was the first day of school. I got to wear my new outfit that Mom bought. I met a lot of new friends. My favorite class is music.
text_b: I hate school.

label: negative
text_a: Carl was in Florida and enjoying the day in his house. He was watching tv and out of no where an alert popped up. The alert warn the residents of a chance there will be a tsunami. Carl was scared and began evacuating.
text_b: He changed his mind and returned to watching TV.

label: negative
text_a: Steve was an accomplished carpenter. He had a plan to surprise his wife with a new piece. She had been wanting a new desk, so that's what he decided to make. He cut all the lumber, assembled the desk, and stained it.
text_b: Steve's wife filed for divorce that same day.

label: negative
text_a: Ron has anger problems. During a trip to the store, he got angry at a slow cashier. The cashier was sassy, and egged him on further. Ron grabbed the cashier by the shirt, and pulled him over the counter.
text_b: Ron was given a prize by the store.

label: positive
text_a: Ford was proud of his high GPA. He worked every evening on assignments in order to improve it. Ford's friends warned him that he was missing out on fun. Later in life, Ford became a successful lawyer.
text_b: Ford was proud of his accomplishments.

label: negative
text_a: Lia was trying to lose weight. She cut out junk food and fatty foods. But she still struggled to lose weight. Then she began running every day on her treadmill.
text_b: She gained 50 pounds.

label: positive
text_a: Billy wanted to become a doctor. He went to college to become a doctor. After he graduated with his degree, he changed his mind. Billy became a nurse instead of a doctor.
text_b: He never regretted his decision.

label: negative
text_a: When I first met Janice, she didn't know how to crack a walnut. I couldn't believe she had gotten this far in life without this skill. I offered to teach her many methods to crack nuts. She accepted.
text_b: Janice decided she didn't want to learn how to crack walnuts.

label: negative
text_a: Dan was sure that he was over his ex girlfriend. Until a mutual friend posted a picture of her in a restaurant. The picture brought Dan back to the good times. He felt regret.

text_a: Eddie always felt different than everyone else. Last week he was alone in an elevator. He heard a voice telling him what floor to go to. It freaked him out and he's seeking mental help.
text_b: Eddie needed medication.

label: positive
text_a: Billy's friends thought that he was a scaredy cat. They dared him to go into the haunted house. He decided to go in and even stay the night there. Despite how scared he was he stayed the entire night.
text_b: Billy felt brave.

label: negative
text_a: Aurelia was given an ice cream maker for her birthday. She had never thought of making nice cream before. She gathered the ingredients for her first vanilla ice cream. Aurelia was amazed with how delicious her homemade ice cream was.
text_b: She threw her ice cream in the garbage.

label: negative
text_a: Bob wanted a hamburger. But he also wanted to eat healthier. So he decided to make a veggie burger. Bob thought it wasn't as good as a normal burger.
text_b: He was excited.

label: negative
text_a: Emmy's dad took her to chose a kitten. There were two together in a cage. She couldn't split them up! It made her sad to have to chose.
text_b: Emmy left angry because she wanted a dog.

label: positive
text_a: Barry was excited that he finally registered to vote. He went to the polling place near his home. While walking into the building he noticed all of the campaign signs. He already knew how he would cast his votes.
text_b: Barry voted.

label: negative
text_a: John was driving to the store when he realized he forgot his wallet. His driver's license was in the wallet. Police lights started flashing behind him. After pulling over he told the officer he forgot his wallet at home.
text_b: John then proceeded to assault the officer.

label: negative
text_a: Jim was waiting at the airport. His wife would be there in an hour. He was very bored. He then decided to catch up on his book.
text_b: Jim drove away before his wife showed.

label: negative
text_a: The kids were very excited about christmas. They have been good all year. They sent a letter to Santa. Santa responded back in the mail.
text_b: The letter stated they would be getting no gifts.

label: positive
text_a: Steve was very sad. Steve's girlfriend broke up with him. He decided to write a song to her. He poured his heart into the song.
text_b: Steve wondered if they could ever get back together.

label: positive
text_a: It was a beautiful summer day outside. Bob decided to go for a walk at the park. Bob walked along the path and admired the scenery. He found a twenty dollar bill on the ground.
text_b: He was happy.

label: negative
text_a: Biff wanted to watch a western movie. Biff also wanted to watch a movie in theaters. Westerns had lost favor with the public and none were showing. Biff decided to screen a classic western himself.
text_b: Biff hated western movies.

label: negative
text_a: Lars had always wanted to try photography. His friend was an excellent photographer, but he had never tried. One day he bought a simple, but high quality, camera. From that day on, Lars shot images of nature every day.
text_b: Lars hated photography.

label: positive
text_a: Sam was stargazing one night. Suddenly he sat bolt upright. He saw a twinkling, moving star! He ran to show it to his dad.
text_b: His dad laughed because the star was really a jet with lights.

label: negative
text_a: A group of workers from Mechanical Turk joined a forum. They formed a clique and demanded more and more power. Andy, the forum owner, had enough, and told them as much. They haughtily stomped off to make a forum of only themselves.
text_b: They returned to the forum later because they liked it so much.

label: positive
text_a: Paul worked as order taker at a fast food drive thru. Customers noticed he had a really nice voice. People suggested he should work in radio. Paul quit his job at the fast food restaurant.
text_b: Paul got a new job as a radio dj.

label: negative
text_a: Karen and Diane had been best friends since childhood. Now high school seniors, they've started thinking about college. They both applied to Cornell and planned to room together. Karen was accepted but Diane was not, which was hard for both of them.
text_b: Diane decided she hated Karen more than ever before.

label: positive
text_a: Jill wanted to buy a new car. Jill drove her old car down to the car dealership. The salesman traded Jill's old car for a new car. After paying the salesman as well, Jill got her new car.
text_b: Jill was excited.

label: positive
text_a: Last Friday I ate lunch with my niece. We went to a restaurant that had a jungle theme. My niece was excited because the restaurant was so cool. We ate our meals, and shared a dessert.
text_b: This would be our new favorite restaurant.

label: positive
text_a: Emma liked to paint. For her friend's birthday, she gave her a painting. Another person saw the painting at her friend's house. She called Emma and asked her to create paintings for her restaurant.
text_b: Emma was happy to have a new audience for her work.

label: positive
text_a: I put together a list of factoids and trivia. I included them in a small booklet. I got a bunch of them printed. I sold it as a coffeeeee table or bathroom reader.
text_b: I made a little bit of money.

label: negative
text_a: I put the black plastic rose in a vase with water. I left it atop my bookcase for a few weeks. Ten people asked me about it. They wanted to know why I had a watered, fake flower.
text_b: After a few weeks the flower died.

label: positive
text_a: Today was the club opening of a new club around the corner. I couldn't wait to attend. As we got in the club it was beautiful. We ordered delicious food and danced.
text_b: We befriended the bouncer so we would get into the club tomorrow.

label: negative
text_a: Allison decided she wanted to learn more about her area's history. She went down to the library to check out a book on it. She went inside and couldn't understand how the books were sorted. She found a librarian who explained the dewey decimal system.
text_b: That helped her figure out which car she didn't want.

label: positive
text_a: My chest hair was getting out of control. I decided I needed to take some trimmers to it. I stepped into the shower and started to shave it off. The hair started to plug the drain because there was so much.
text_b: I decided to get it waxed.

label: positive
text_a: Lance wanted to have a romantic evening with his wife. He put the kids to bed early and started dinner. He forgot to check the cooking and burned down the kitchen. His wife arrived to the fire department.
text_b: His wife was so angry she took the kids to sleep at the Grandmas.

label: negative
text_a: Around 11am, the school's fire alarm went off. Rushing towards the door, the students stopped when gunshots rang out. Then the teacher instructed them to hide under their desks. Diving under their desks, the students were petrified.
text_b: They then played heads down thumbs up.

label: positive
text_a: Joy wanted to find the perfect shell for her hermit crab. She could buy one, but it would be more special if she found it. She scoured the beach all morning. Everything that might work was broken!
text_b: She had to buy a shell after all.

label: positive
text_a: When I was young we used to drive from Florida to Michigan yearly. We would pack up all our stuff and load them into the truck. We would leave early in the morning to make the most of our time. Driving, eating, and sleeping were the only reasons we would stop.
text_b: My dad always drove safely and we arrived quickly.

label: positive
text_a: Lance and Adam were best friends. When Lance joined the Army, Adam signed up, too. They were in the same unit and were deployed together. Lance took a bullet for Adam.
text_b: Adam was never able to repay Lance.

label: positive
text_a: A police officer came down with the flu today. He was unable to go into work as he could barely get out of bed. His wife spent time taking care of him and making sure he was okay. He made sure to drink enough and eat enough.
text_b: The police officer eventually got better.

label: negative
text_a: Kaylee went to work at Cedar Point, the amusement park. While working at Cedar Point, she met James. Kaylee and James started to like each other and soon started dating. One year later, James proposed to Kaylee.
text_b: James was sad about the proposal.

label: negative
text_a: Pat woke up with the urge to play hooky from work. So he called in that morning using a fake sick voice. Not even an hour after calling in he gets a text. It tells him work is cancelled because it's snowing.
text_b: Pat got in his car and drove to work.

label: negative
text_a: A group of children played marbles one afternoon. Or at least, they tried to. There was a great deal of arguing. Ultimately, they gave up and played something else.
text_b: The children decided to play marbles.

label: negative
text_a: Gina and her friends were outside of the school library. They wanted to go inside. But the librarian was not in in the library. The girls weren't sure where she could be.
text_b: Gina hated the library.

label: negative
text_a: Julie wants to make food for lunch for the upcoming week. She decides to hard boil a dozen eggs. Julie boils water and dumps the eggs in for 8 minutes each. Finally her eggs are boiled perfectly.
text_b: Julie makes lunches for her son who is allergic to eggs.

label: negative
text_a: Kev's dad asked to take him hunting. Kev said he'd consider it. Then he decided he didn't like hunting. He thought it was cruelty to animals.
text_b: Kev was excited to try out his new gun.

label: negative
text_a: Bonnie needed a new job. She searched the newspaper employment section. She found a listing for a job as a nanny. She called the listed number to arrange an interview.
text_b: Bonnie called to say she didn't want an interview.

label: positive
text_a: We decided we would learn to make candy. We checked out a book on the subject and read up. Then, we set to work trying. We realized greatly overestimated how hard it was to make candy.
text_b: We found we made a mess in the kitchen.

label: positive
text_a: Frank did not want to do his homework. He wanted to play video games instead. Frank's parents told him to do his homework first. Frank threw a tantrum and got punished.
text_b: Frank lost his video games for a week.

label: positive
text_a: Anne always wanted one of the lilies that grew in the pond. They were so far out, she could never reach them. One summer she took a rake and attempted to pull one in. To her shock, she still could not get the lily!
text_b: Anne was very sad.

label: positive
text_a: I've gotten three speeding tickets in my life. All three of them when I was a teenager. I'm surprised I didn't loose my license. It costs me a lot of money to get them all off my record.
text_b: I now drive at a normal speed.

label: negative
text_a: Bobby needed to get home from work late one night. He decided that he was going to hail a taxi. When he was in the taxi he realized that he knew the driver. On the way home they chatted about things.
text_b: Bobby asked to be taken to a restaurant.

label: positive
text_a: Kayla borrowed a book from her sister. She brought the book with her to a coffee shop to read. Kayla accidentally spilled some of her vanilla latte on the book. She immediately went home to inform her sister.
text_b: Her sister was mad!

label: positive
text_a: Mary had a credit card debt of over $2000. She wanted to pay it off. She cut off her unnecessary expenses such as going out. She saved all her money in a savings account.
text_b: Gradually, Mary was able to pay off her debt.

label: positive
text_a: Jason had always admired the fast movements of boxers he saw on TV. He started training to become a boxer in his spare time. He practiced jabs and jumped rope for hours each day. Finally he was a great boxer.
text_b: He won his first fight by knockout.

label: negative
text_a: Kaya needed to buy a new dress for the upcoming Spring Formal. She went to the mall with several of her friends. The girls all had a good time visiting shops and trying on dresses. Kaya found a dress that she loved that was a nice coral color.
text_b: She couldn't resist so she bought the antique vase.

label: negative
text_a: Beverly was ready for a change. She decided to pack all her stuff and load her car and leave. She figured everything is big in Texas and she would just get lost. In the big city she could be anyone and do anything she wanted.
text_b: She decided to go back home.

label: positive
text_a: Cara went to a food cart in Philadelphia the other day. She stopped by an amazing falafel cart. The food was amazing. Cara couldn't believe how good it was.
text_b: Cara decided to eat at the food cart every week.

label: negative
text_a: Tiffany bought a bag of microwave popcorn. She didn't read the directions. She put the bag in the microwave and pushed the popcorn button. Minutes later she smelled something horrible.
text_b: The popcorn was prepared to perfection.

label: positive
text_a: Bob was a worker on Mechanical Turk. He got a fifty dollar bonus. Bob was happy because it was the biggest bonus he had gotten. Bob put on his glasses and realized it was actually five dollars.
text_b: Bob was still happy, but less excited.

label: negative
text_a: Ava brought home a catfish. She put it into her tank. She wasn't sure how the other fish would react. She watched apprehensively.
text_b: Ava flushed all the aquarium water down the toilet.

label: negative
text_a: Jim lost his wallet that had all of his money it. He would have no more money for food for his family until next month. Meanwhile, Pete found a wallet lying in the bank parking lot. It contained hundreds of dollars and Pete really wanted a new TV.
text_b: Pete kept the wallet and donated the money to charity.

label: negative
text_a: We spent our thirtieth anniversary on the California coast. It was chilly and foggy and drizzly. I had plans to spend time on the beach with my water colors. On our third day we discovered a family of whales near the pier.
text_b: I drove to New York that same night.

label: negative
text_a: Anna wanted to bake a cake for her mom's birthday. She tried twice, but both cakes fell flat. Then she found a solution. She went to the bakery and bought a cake.
text_b: She ate the cake alone at home.

label: positive
text_a: Yesterday was Rob's tooth cleaning. He is normally really afraid of dentists. But there's a cute new nurse at the office. So he was excited to go.
text_b: Rob was bummed when the cute nurse wasn't in that day.

label: negative
text_a: Tim bought a record player at a thrift shop. He didn't have any records to play on it. He asked his parents if they had any. They gave him their entire record collection from their youth.
text_b: He broke the records one by one as his parents watched.

label: positive
text_a: Brian was excited for the talent show. He had been doing extra practice on his drums. To express his individuality he wore a skirt on stage. When he finished his act he got a standing ovation.
text_b: Brian was very creative and brave.

label: positive
text_a: Bob was playing volleyball. He suddenly felt very dizzy and fell down. His friends quickly rushed to his aid. Bob was dehydrated from exerting himself.
text_b: Bob's friends quickly brought him some water to hydrate him.

label: negative
text_a: Glen was in the mood for a walk. He put on his jacket and went outside. While walking on the sidewalk, he tripped and busted his knee open. Glen stood back up and limped back to his house.
text_b: Glen ran his best marathon time ever.

label: positive
text_a: My wife says I lack passion. That I don't have many hobbies or interests. I tried to argue but couldn't. I realized she was right.
text_b: I decided to change.

label: negative
text_a: Everybody loved Bob because he played a popular character on film. Bob hated it because he was nothing like that character. Jim asked Bob to say his character's catch phrase. It was too much for Bob and he exploded with rage.
text_b: Bob asked the man for tea.

label: positive
text_a: Gina and her friend Tami were walking to their classroom. Down the hall Gina could see he bully who had tripped her. Gina tried to keep her composure. She took a deep breath and put on a weak smile.
text_b: Tami told the bully to get lost, and he looked intimidated.

label: positive
text_a: Alex ran across town to get to a friends house. He didn't know his shoe was untied. He had ran for three block when it happened. He tripped on that shoelace of his.
text_b: Alex resolved to always check his shoelaces before leaving.

label: negative
text_a: The first day of school I walked there with two of my closest friends. We were all very nervous. When we got to school we checked the class list for third grade. All three of us were assigned to the same classroom!
text_b: All three of us were very disappointed.

label: positive
text_a: Arthur and his friends were hanging out. They were drinking beers and talking. All of a sudden the beer ran out. Arthur didn't want to take the last one.
text_b: Arthur ordered another round for his friends.

label: positive
text_a: Tony was happy to be going on his first cruise. He arrived at the docks and was ready with all his luggage. When he walked around the corner he couldn't believe the size of it. He boarded and the ship left the docks.
text_b: Tony enjoyed going on the cruise.

label: positive
text_a: Sal hurt his leg when his wife accidentally tripped him. She felt so bad that she waited on him hand and foot. She bought him food and gave him messages. Sal liked all the attention.
text_b: Sal's leg eventually healed.

label: positive
text_a: Jen was so confident in her preparations for the county spelling bee. She had spent the past month studying the dictionary every night. When the Bee started, Jen survived as others got knocked out. It all came down to the final two and Jen's opponent had messed up.
text_b: Jen won the spelling bee!

label: negative
text_a: Simon got food poisoning. He thought back on all the restaurants he's recently visited. He called his friends who ate with him on these occasions. One of his friends informed him he was also sick with food poisoning.
text_b: They went back to eat at the same restaurant.

label: negative
text_a: Rufus notices that he has let his fingernails grow too long. They are making a loud tapping sound when he types on his computer. Rufus decides to cut his fingernails one night. When he's finally finished, he feels relieved.
text_b: His fingernails are way too long.

label: negative
text_a: Jody was a very hard worker. She always did her best and often worked overtime. Jody's boss noticed her efforts and decided to give her a promotion. Her hard work had paid off!
text_b: Jody was fired on the spot.

label: negative
text_a: Tom bit into the Snickers bar and felt a jabbing pain. A small pebble in it made one of his teeth snap in half! He rushed to the dentist. Because it was an emergency, they saw him right away.
text_b: Tom had so much fun that day.

label: positive
text_a: Jake is one of my roommates. He took a gap year last year to work as a chef in Australia. Since the dining hall food was subpar we decided to cook. He taught me how to cook and season a steak.
text_b: Jake has kept all of us well-fed all year.

label: negative
text_a: Ben was excited to go fishing with his grandfather for the first time. However, he found putting the worms on the hook to be disgusting. He accidentally pricked his finger with one of the hooks, too. Ben soon realized that fishing was not for him.
text_b: Ben asked his grandfather when they could go fishing next.

label: positive
text_a: Damon lost his wallet with his ID in it. He searched all over the house. He couldn't find it anywhere. He eventually just went and got a replacement ID.
text_b: The next day, Damon found his wallet under the bed.

label: negative
text_a: Amanda was watching a squirrel collect acorns. Amanda was fascinated with how efficient the squirrel was. Amanda watched the squirrel as he carried the acorns to his nest. Amanda also saw how the squirrel was very watchful over the acorns.
text_b: Amanda finds nature boring.

label: negative
text_a: It was my first time skiing and I was not doing well. I skied directly in the path of another skier. We collided and both fell to the ground. The other skier told me his name was Jack and it was nice to meet me.
text_b: I thought Jack was very rude.

label: negative
text_a: Jon graduated from college and began his job search. He applied for jobs in his field every day. Three weeks after he began, he got a call. The person calling asked if he would be interested in an interview.
text_b: Jon rejected the offer.

label: negative
text_a: Coming out of College, I was so nervous to start work. I could barely sleep the week before my start date. The day of, I was nauseous and jittery. However, a congratulatory text from my parents cheered me up.
text_b: I ended up leaving early because I was sick.

label: negative
text_a: Ali went to a fast food place and paid with her credit card. The cashier took a very long time bringing her card back. A few days later, Ali found unusual transactions on her card. She called her bank, who reversed the charges.
text_b: She made sure to thank the fast food cashier.

label: positive
text_a: Quentin had never been on a boat in his life. One summer a friend invited Quentin to his lake house. When they were there, Quentin and his friend went sailing. It was an exhilarating experience.
text_b: Quentin was glad that he went.

label: positive
text_a: Holly asked her brother to put suntan lotion on her back. He took his time and applied it very carefully. Later that day, Holly wondered why people were laughing. She later realized her brother had made a design with the lotion.
text_b: Holly yelled at her brother to get back at him.

label: negative
text_a: My roommate got a new job at the place I go to school. We decided to ride to work together. We got in the car and headed out together. The ride seemed much shorter with someone to talk to.
text_b: I did not have anyone to talk to though.

label: positive
text_a: Ava brought home a catfish. She put it into her tank. She wasn't sure how the other fish would react. She watched apprehensively.
text_b: All the fish got along fine.

label: negative
text_a: Shay was hiking in the woods. Then she realized she was lost! She tried not to panic. She retraced her steps until she found her way back to camp.
text_b: Shay was finally found weeks later in the woods.

label: positive
text_a: Rakesh decides that he would like to cook lobster for dinner. He visits the local seafood market and picks a huge lobster. Rakesh brings it home and boils it in water. He eats the lobster with butter and corn on the cob.
text_b: Rakesh loved eating lobster.

label: negative
text_a: Rae's family sat down for Sunday lunch. Rae's brother accidentally spilled his drink. Rae's stepfather yelled and threw his plate across the room. Rae watched the plate shatter into a million pieces.
text_b: Rae asked his brother for the name of his plumber.

label: positive
text_a: Ava was mad that she had to wear a vest in the pool. She wanted to swim without a vest like her brother. She asked her mother if she could take swimming lessons. Ava took lessons for 6 weeks and learned how to swim.
text_b: She was happy that she didn't have to wear a vest anymore.

label: positive
text_a: I was walking to the store recently. As I was passing an exit, I felt cold, hard steel on my arm. I was shocked that I was being hit by a car! The driver was very apologetic after he saw I was hit.
text_b: I told them it was okay and then walked away.

label: positive
text_a: Roy couldn't figure out why his apartment smelled so bad. His friends commented on it when they went over. Everyone decided to look for the source. It turned out to be an old fish in the refrigerator.
text_b: Roy threw out the old fisher and everything smelled better.

label: positive
text_a: Jim complained that his wife never did the dishes. She then complained that Jim never cooked dinner. The next day they decided to switch their roles. The meal was horrible and dishes didn't get cleaned well enough.
text_b: They both decided to go back to their previous roles.

label: negative
text_a: Jim made spinach cookies. He sold them for five dollars each. No one bought any. However, at the last minute a man wanted twenty.
text_b: Jim thought he was crazy and left.

label: negative
text_a: A police officer came down with the flu today. He was unable to go into work as he could barely get out of bed. His wife spent time taking care of him and making sure he was okay. He made sure to drink enough and eat enough.
text_b: The police officer had to give up his badge and gun.

label: negative
text_a: Mim was driving down the highway in a bad snow storm. There was so much snow, Mim pulled her car over. She noticed other people were doing the same. She got an emergency blanket from the backseat, and ate a snack.
text_b: Mim pulled back onto the road and drove faster to make up time.

label: positive
text_a: One night, a group of friends decided to play with a Ouija board. It was all in fun, and they played for an hour. After playing, they laid down for bed. Minutes later, they heard a strange banging sound on the floor.
text_b: They all freaked out naturally.

label: negative
text_a: The man at the deli wrapped a sandwich for a customer. He took out a brown bag and set it on the counter. The deli man took the sandwich and tossed it into the bag. The bag fell over when the sandwich hit it.
text_b: The man at the deli said the sandwich would cost more now.

label: negative
text_a: Gina was using a restroom at a gas station. She went to wash her hands, but there was no soap. She looked in the cabinet under the sink hoping to find some. There was no soap there either.
text_b: Gina stole al the soap that was in the bathroom.

label: positive
text_a: Kelly was reading about hybrid animals online. And she saw pictures of ligers. She was impressed by their size and strength. But she wondered if they could live in the wild.
text_b: Kelly had only seen them  in  the  zoo.

label: positive
text_a: One day, my computer mouse stopped working. I went to the store to buy a new one. Every mouse I found was too expensive. I went home and decided to try and fix my mouse.
text_b: I was successful.

label: negative
text_a: Jake is one of my roommates. He took a gap year last year to work as a chef in Australia. Since the dining hall food was subpar we decided to cook. He taught me how to cook and season a steak.
text_b: Now we all go to the dining hall instead of cooking.

label: positive
text_a: Hannah was an amazing artist. She always had a natural gift. She decided to enter in an art competition. Thankfully she was able to win the top prize.
text_b: Her parents were very proud.

label: positive
text_a: Donna's toddler son, Ty, didn't like having his nails clipped. The child's nails had grown longer than she was comfortable with. Donna decided to wait until he was asleep. Once Ty was napping, Donna quietly clipped each nail.
text_b: Donna had a much easier time because Ty was asleep.

label: positive
text_a: Sarah had never been on a boat before. Today her mom took her to the pier for her very first boat ride. Sarah was very excited. She stepped on the boat and heard the engine roar.
text_b: She loved every minute of it.

label: positive
text_a: Pete had to meet with his realtor. He was soon to buy a house. Pete could not find the contract given to him by his realtor. He looked all over his home.
text_b: He finally found it in the garage.

label: positive
text_a: Sal liked magic. He always tried to pulled tricks for his family. He tried to pull a rabbit out of his hat on day. But the hat ripped and the rabbit fell through.
text_b: And thus Sal gave up on magic.

label: negative
text_a: Terry realizes his neighborhood has become covered in litter. He wishes it looked as clean as it did when he was young. He decides to pick up cans and cigarette butts every night after work. Eventually his neighbors do too and his neighborhood looks better.
text_b: Terry hated cleaning up.

label: negative
text_a: Ali always takes the train to get to work each day. One day she was very sick but still went to work. She worked hard all day and even took work home. She got on the train and fell asleep.
text_b: She was a lazy employee.

label: negative
text_a: Jerry told all his friends he was running a marathon. He had some of them sponsor him. He never actually prepared for it. He was freaking out on the day of it.
text_b: Jerry won the marathon.

label: negative
text_a: It was summer and Gina and her sister were bored. They decided to watch music videos. There was the music video channel or the black entertainment channel. They chose to watch the black entertainment channel.
text_b: Gina disliked spending time with her sister.

label: positive
text_a: Driving home from work the other day I got a flat tire. It was rainy and cold out. I could have called the towing company but chose not to. Instead I changed the tire myself.
text_b: I was miserable but saved a ton.

label: positive
text_a: Jeffries's remote ran out of batteries. It stopped working completely. He needed to replace them. So he went to the store to buy some more.
text_b: He made sure to buy rechargeable batteries this time.

label: negative
text_a: Kelly decided to have a house party. Her parents were going away so she decided to have one. She invited all her friends. When they got there they had a good time.
text_b: Kelly had a neurological disorder that kept her in a wheelchair.

label: positive
text_a: Johnny was on his local Little League team. One Saturday, his team had a very important game. His parents were able to attend. Johnny's team won the game.
text_b: Johnny was elated.

label: negative
text_a: Jim was in a go cart race. He designed his go kart by himself. While he raced, his tires fell off. He didn't know what to do.
text_b: He finished in first place.

label: positive
text_a: Robert and Sharon met at band camp when they were in high school. By the time they graduated they had plans to marry. Now they are expecting their first great grandchild. Sharon can't believe that so much time passed so fast.
text_b: But she is as happy today as she was the day they met.

label: positive
text_a: A boy needed to learn to drive. He asked his father and he said yes. They began to look for a first car. In the newspaper ads, they found a nice looking car.
text_b: They bought the car.

label: negative
text_a: Lia went to England. She took a bus tour. The tour stopped at Stonehenge. Lia got out of the bus to look.
text_b: Lia hated going to England.

label: positive
