text_b: Sal hated the brace.

label: positive
text_a: Ora had been dared not to shower in order to join a sorority. She couldn't imagine going without clean water for a week! Then she thought of a loophole. They hadn't said Ora couldn't take a bath!
text_b: Ora took a bath.

label: positive
text_a: Johnny's teacher treated the class to homemade snow cones. The teacher let each student pick a colored syrup topping. When his turn came, Johnny got mad when he saw only one color left. Johnny's teacher asked what was wrong.
text_b: Johnny told the teacher he was upset he didn't get more colors.

label: positive
text_a: The children were inside playing when they heard music. They ran to their mother and begged for change. She handed them a couple of dollars. They took off running outside, catching up to the ice cream truck.
text_b: The children excitedly bought ice cream cones.

label: positive
text_a: Barry loved to lift weights. He only used his special barbell to lift weights. One day he forgot to bring his barbell! He decided to do cardio instead of lifting.
text_b: He still ended up having a great workout.

label: positive
text_a: One day, I went to the zoo with my friends. I heard the zoo had sloths, and I had always wanted to see them. We visited almost all of the exhibits, but did not see any sloths. We finally found the sloths in the very last exhibit.
text_b: We were gratified.

label: negative
text_a: All of Javier's friends at school have smartphones. However, he still uses an old style flip phone. One day he decides to buy a smartphone too. At first he loves having the access to internet everywhere he goes.
text_b: Javier decides to get a smartphone.

label: negative
text_a: Tammy likes to crochet. Christmas was a few weeks away and she didn't really have money. She got the idea to take the spare yarn she had to make a blanket. She then wrapped it up for her grandchild Lorelei.
text_b: Tammy was sad that she didn't have a present to give.

label: positive
text_a: Gina had detention. It was her first time. She talked with friends outside the room while pretending to be cool. Inside her stomach was turning in knots.
text_b: Gina was worried about her parents finding out.

label: negative
text_a: A boy saw a quarter lying on the sidewalk. He bent down and picked it up. As he did so, a spitball flew where his head had been. Looking around, he saw his archenemy holding a straw.
text_b: The boy was grateful.

label: positive
text_a: Jaris wanted to pick some wildflowers for his vase. He went to the state park. He picked many kinds of flowers. Little did Jaris realize that it was a national park.
text_b: Jaris got in trouble and apologized profusely.

label: negative
text_a: Suzie decided to make her grandmother's spaghetti sauce. She made the sauce. She added mushrooms. She added the seasonings.
text_b: Suzie's relationship with her grandmother remained complicated.

label: negative
text_a: Remy liked to drink milk. But one day, she spilled milk all over her carpet. And she didn't think bother to clean the spill properly. The next morning, she woke up to a terrible smell.
text_b: Remy felt it was a good idea to spill more milk on the carpet.

label: negative
text_a: Larry was scared of heights. He always planned his travels to avoid any tall bridges. Unfortunately for Larry, one day he was diverted onto another route. Larry started sweating as he saw the bridge looming over him.
text_b: Larry laughed with joy as he drove over the bridge.

label: positive
text_a: Iva and Brant were trying to conceive a child. They had been trying for six months with no success. At their doctor's appointment, they expressed discouragement. But then they saw the doctor smiling broadly.
text_b: The couple will be happy to know they have a baby on the way.

label: negative
text_a: Matt started playing baseball when he was seven. Now seventeen Year's old he still had not hit a homerun. Today was not only his last game, it was also the championship. Bottom of ninth, Matt was up at bat with two strikes to his name
text_b: Matt scored a touchdown at the last minute.

label: positive
text_a: I approached the front of my school. Since my brother was at work, I had to wait for him to pick me up. Several hours later, I was impatiently waiting. He eventually came before night time.
text_b: I was very angry at him for not picking me up earlier.

label: negative
text_a: The Dungeons & Dragons game was on. Joseph showed up in an elf ensemble. Mary brought a broomstick sword. Laney convinced everyone her big stick was in fact a staff.
text_b: They all had poor imaginations.

label: positive
text_a: Neil was visiting Romania. He had just arrived and was excited to see Transylvania. When he got there, he saw gorgeous old castles. He also found friendly locals.
text_b: Neil enjoyed visiting Transylvania.

label: negative
text_a: Portia loves walking through the woods nearby her house. However, she notices that her sneakers are becoming muddy and gross. She decides to buy a pair of hiking boots. Portia finds a pair that is comfortable and not too expensive.
text_b: She donates the boots to the thrift store.

label: positive
text_a: Gloria wanted to buy flowers for her husband. Gloria was shocked at the price of even just half a dozen lilies. Gloria decided to pick some of her own flowers from the garden. She got together some daffodils and chrysanthemums.
text_b: Gloria's husband appreciated the gesture.

label: positive
text_a: I walked inside of the dentists office. After signing the attendance board, the dentist greeted me. He showed me where to sit. Afterwards, he started to operate on my teeth.
text_b: I was nervous but he reassured me that everything was fine.

label: negative
text_a: Lester has always wanted to be more artistic. He decides to try to draw a picture of a flower one day. He sits in front of a beautiful orchid and begins to draw. Lester's drawing comes out very well.
text_b: He decides never to draw anything again.

label: positive
text_a: Celina is very old. Her hips are always sore. It is hard for her to walk. One day, she obtained a walker.
text_b: It helped her a lot.

label: negative
text_a: Jackie has been designated eighth grade hall monitor. She is envied throughout the class. Classmates often put her job in jeopardy. They would steal Jackie's hall passes.
text_b: Her classmates were given awards for their behavior.

label: negative
text_a: My garden flowers are dying. They are wilting and dry from the sun. My friend came by to help evaluate what is wrong with my plants. She discovered they needed more water.
text_b: I didn't water them again.

label: positive
text_a: Matt found a puppy wandering down the street. It looked lost and scared, so Matt took it home. Matt's mom called some neighbors, and eventually found its owner. The puppy's owner was so relieved to know his puppy was safe!
text_b: The puppy's owner gave Matt a reward for finding it.

label: negative
text_a: Tom wanted a Chemistry set for Christmas. His mom said it was too dangerous for a little boy. Tom asked for a puppy instead, and his mom suddenly changed her mind. Tom didn't understand why, but he didn't care.
text_b: He was disappointed to receive the Chemistry set.

label: negative
text_a: Jesse had always wanted to get a tattoo. Her parents were very against the idea of tattoos. One her 18th birthday she decided to get one. She got a small tiara tattoo on her shoulder.
text_b: Jesse's parents were excited to see the tattoo.

label: negative
text_a: Mike always had Golden Retriever dogs when he was growing up. Now that he had a steady job, he felt ready to have a dog too. Mike got a Golden Retriever and named him Spot. Now Mike and Spot take walks in the park every weekend.
text_b: Mike thought Spot was a strange cat, but he liked him.

label: negative
text_a: Jane wanted to learn how to juggle. Jane consulted with a professional juggler to teach her. Jane went to three classes with the professional juggler. After three weeks, Jane was juggling.
text_b: Jane was untalented.

label: positive
text_a: My brother kept fighting me for the remote last week. Finally we decided to divide its use. We would each get to have it one day. My brother then got into a fight who should have it the first day.
text_b: I agreed to let my brother use the remote first.

label: positive
text_a: I was at the laundromat last Sunday. There was a cute girl doing her laundry there too. I went up and started making small talk. She smiled but didn't seem interested.
text_b: I left her alone but kept sneaking little glances.

label: positive
text_a: Todd was not careful with his electrical appliances. He plugged in an old toaster with a frayed cord. When he was out of the room, he smelled a strange sound. The toaster had caught fire!
text_b: He used a fire extinguisher to save the day.

label: negative
text_a: Tori was so excited to go trick or treating. She put on her costume and ran out the door. She began to eat the candy as fast as she got it. Soon her stomach hurt.
text_b: Tori felt even better afterwards.

label: negative
text_a: My professor assigned my class an essay. By the time I left the classroom, I had forgotten about it. A few days later, my classmate messaged me to ask if I had done it. I was so upset because I had totally forgotten!
text_b: I was sure I would get an A if I didn't turn in my essay.

label: negative
text_a: White roses were Lilly's favorite flower. She grew them in her garden. One day she pricked her finger on a thorn. She thought nothing of it.
text_b: Lilly's finger had to be amputated.

label: positive
text_a: Bobby needed to get home from work late one night. He decided that he was going to hail a taxi. When he was in the taxi he realized that he knew the driver. On the way home they chatted about things.
text_b: Bobby found the time passed quickly.

label: positive
text_a: Tom bit into the Snickers bar and felt a jabbing pain. A small pebble in it made one of his teeth snap in half! He rushed to the dentist. Because it was an emergency, they saw him right away.
text_b: The dentist fixed his tooth.

label: negative
text_a: Amayah's birthday is coming up. She will be five Year's old. Her mom is throwing her a princess party. She is invited a lot of her friends from school.
text_b: Amayah is sad because she doesn't want a tea party.

label: positive
text_a: Ana had been putting off doing laundry. Finally she could avoid it no longer. She carried all her clothes to the laundromat. Over several hours, she washed and dried them.
text_b: Ana decided never to wait that long again.

label: negative
text_a: I woke up for my class at 8:30 in the morning. I drowsily got out of bed and took a shower. I quickly ate breakfast and began to walk to class. After 50 minutes of class, I began to walk back to my dorm.
text_b: I decided to go back to class again.

label: negative
text_a: At a party on Friday everyone decided to play musical chairs. The game involved dozens of people. Eventually it was narrowed down to two. It was two girls.
text_b: The girls ran a marathon.

label: positive
text_a: Uki was traveling in Africa. One night, he was bit by a black mamba. Uki screamed in pain! He was rushed to the local hospital.
text_b: They gave him the antidote which saved his life.

label: negative
text_a: Jane needed a new kidney. Only Bob was a match. Bob didn't know Jane, but that didn't matter. Bob gave Jane his kidney.
text_b: Jane was very bad at Bob.

label: positive
text_a: Sydney needed to do the laundry. She sorted her dirty clothes by color. She dumped the first load into the washer. She added the detergent and fabric softener.
text_b: She continued to do this until the laundry was done.

label: negative
text_a: Sue woke up in the middle of the night to an awful smell. She could not figure out what it was. She looked around the room. Then she noticed saw it.
text_b: Sarah began to watch tv.

label: negative
text_a: Iva and Brant were trying to conceive a child. They had been trying for six months with no success. At their doctor's appointment, they expressed discouragement. But then they saw the doctor smiling broadly.
text_b: Brant will cancel his plans to kidnap a child.

label: positive
text_a: Cole was given coal for Christmas as a gag gift. Cole was young and took it very seriously. Cole was well-behaved for months after that. Eventually Cole forgot about the incident.
text_b: Cole never got coal again.

label: positive
text_a: When I was sixteen I learned to drive. The first time I got into the car I lost track of the brake pedal. I didn't know how to stop! My dad had to turn on the emergency brake.
text_b: After that mistake, I became much more cautious.

label: negative
text_a: One year, Matt was training for a half marathon. Near the time of the race, he slipped on a run and damaged his knee. Matt missed the race and required an extensive rehab. As soon as he could, Matt was back to training.
text_b: Matt trained hard to return to being a pianist.

label: negative
text_a: Wendy took her daughter to the orchard with her. They picked a huge bunch of apples and brought them home. Together, they peeled and cleaned the apples. Wendy and daughter baked them into a delicious pie.
text_b: Wendy does not like apples.

label: positive
text_a: Harrison was playing a game of volleyball with friends. He hit the ball over the net and scored a point. However emily, on the opposing team also scored. The game was tied, until Harrison scored the winning point.
text_b: Harrison was happy and excited.

label: negative
text_a: Jeb liked peppermint candy. He always had peppermints in his pocket. One day, he saw a pretty girl buying peppermints in the store. He decided it was a sign and boldly asked her out on the spot.
text_b: Jeb got the date but never ate peppermints again.

label: positive
text_a: Rachel adopted a cat over ten Years ago. Suddenly, the cat was acting more lethargic and losing weight. Concerned, Rachel took her cat to the vet. The vet told Rachel that her cat had developed cancer.
text_b: The vet treated her cat's cancer the best they could.

label: negative
text_a: Bob was playing volleyball. He suddenly felt very dizzy and fell down. His friends quickly rushed to his aid. Bob was dehydrated from exerting himself.
text_b: Bob said he felt bloated from drinking too much water.

label: positive
text_a: Aya wanted to be a model. She thought she had a chance since she was thin and pretty. So she entered her town's annual modeling contest. To her shock, she won the contest.
text_b: Aya was very happy about the outcome of the contest.

label: negative
text_a: Jeff is going on a field trip to the rainy forest with his class. Jeff is excited and can't wait to go. When Jeff arrived he was very disappointed. The rainy forest wasn't exciting and there was nothing to do.
text_b: Jeff had a fun time.

label: negative
text_a: I am a different person than I used to be. I used to be heavyset but I lost weight. I took up swimming and lost the weight. I worked out three times week and ate healthy every day.
text_b: I am 300 pounds.

label: positive
text_a: A beautiful bunch of bananas dangled just out of reach. Bobby tried throwing his shoe, but it got stuck. He tried climbing the tree, but he fell. Next, he whacked furiously with a hoe, but it was too short to reach.
text_b: Bobby went into the shed to get a ladder to get the bananas.

label: negative
text_a: Stephanie wanted to make applesauce. She decided to drive to the farm market to pick some delicious apples. As she was walking through the orchard she tripped and fell. She broke both of her wrists.
text_b: Stephanie pushed herself up with her hands.

label: negative
text_a: Reba worried that she was going to be a killer, like her father. He went to prison for murder. Reba spent her entire life doing good deeds. She became a nun, and comforted orphaned children.
text_b: Reba was just like her dad.

label: negative
text_a: Janey and Lynne decided to go to the movies. Janie wanted to see a comedy, but Lynne wanted to see a thrill. When they got to the movie theater, they decided to make a compromise. They chose an action movie that had both comedic and thrilling parts.
text_b: They decided to go to Vegas instead.

label: positive
text_a: Donovan asked Trina to go dancing with him. Trina liked Donovan so she said yes but she was really worried. After school she ran home to ask her Dad for help. When her Dad came home she explained the situation and Dad smiled.
text_b: Trina's dad taught her how to dance.

label: negative
text_a: Bob discovered his truck had a flat tire. He had never changed a tire before. He got out the tire jack and iron. He couldn't remove the bolts.
text_b: Bob drove his truck to the market.

label: negative
text_a: Ben decided to treat himself to a coffee. He paid for the coffee using his debit card. Later, the bank called him saying he over-drafted. They explained that he had to pay a thirty dollar charge.
text_b: Ben was happy after getting the call from the bank.

label: negative
text_a: Lita wanted to watch her favorite show on television. Her kids insisted that she sit down to watch it with them. Lita told them that she had chores to do. Her kids dragged her laundry basket to the living room.
text_b: Lita ordered a pepperoni pizza for lunch.

label: negative
text_a: Six year old Bobby wanted a cat very badly. His parents didn't say no but they weren't excited about it either. One morning a friendly young cat showed up at their door. Bobby was very excited when his mom said it could come inside.
text_b: Bobby stopped liking cats after that day.

label: negative
text_a: Bob needed money to buy food. He was sad that he couldn't eat because he had no money. He decided to write a book about his hard life. People immediately praised the book and bought thousands of copies!
text_b: The public reaction to the book means Bob still goes hungry.

label: positive
text_a: Rase was at the planetarium. He loved the displays and exhibits there! Then he saw a Help Wanted sign posted. Rase applied and was given the job.
text_b: Rase worked at the planetarium for several years.

label: positive
text_a: There was a man from kentucky. He loved a girl who lived in Louisiana. He decided he needed to move. He moved to be with his love.
text_b: The man moved to Kentucky.

label: negative
text_a: Ana was tanning on the beach. She dozed off in the warm sun. She woke three hours later. Her eyes widened as she looked in the mirror.
text_b: Ana was extremely pale.

label: negative
text_a: Andy had always wanted a big kids bike. When he turned six Year's old he asked for a bike for his birthday. He did not know how to ride a bike. On Andy's birthday his mother gave him a bike.
text_b: Andy cried for hours.

label: negative
text_a: Amy wanted more space in her home. She decided to look for a new apartment. Amy found a new apartment for the right price near her job. Amy visited the apartment to see it in person.
text_b: She moved into a smaller, cheaper apartment.
